snippet: Former Canadiens and Blues executive Ron Caron, known as The Professor around hockey for his deep knowledge of the game, died Tuesday at 82.
abstract: Former Canadiens and Blues executive Ron Caron, known as The Professor around hockey for his deep knowledge of the game, died Tuesday at 82.
lead_paragraph: Ron Caron, one of the front office architects behind the dominant Montreal Canadiens teams of the 1970s, was remembered for his knowledge and passion for the game after he died Monday evening at age 82. His death was confirmed by the other team he helped build, the St. Louis Blues.

headline.main: Ron Caron, Former Executive for Blues and Canadiens, Dies
